msContents.summary:
I) Dǝrsan maḥyawi “The Life-Giving Homily” (fols. 3ra-99vb) I-1) Introductory prayer (fol. 3ra-vb l.2) I-2) Reading for Monday, Compline (nǝwam) (fols. 3vb l.2-20va l.7); containing homily (fols. 3vb l.2-9rb l.5; 9va l.10-13ra l.14; 13va l.2-17vb l.5), absolution prayer (fols. 9rb l.6-va l.10; 13ra l.15-13va l.1; 17vb l.6-18ra l.10) and ʾarke-hymn (fols. 18ra l.10-20va l.7). I-3) Reading for Tuesday, Matins (mänfäqä lelit) (fols. 20va l.10-35va l.10); containing homily (fols. 20va l.10-23ra l.14; 25rb l.3-29va l.1; 29vb l.5-32ra; 32va l.3-33va l.10), miracle (fols. 23ra l.14-25rb l.2), absolution prayer (fols. 29va l.2-vb l.5; 32rb-va l.3; 33va l.11-vb l.7) and ʾarke-hymn (fols. 33vb l.7-35va l.10). I-4) Reading for Wednesday, Lauds (nägh) (fols. 35va l.11-47vb l.13); containing homily (fols. 35va l.11-40va l.10; 42vb l.8-44ra l.11; 44rb l.13-45vb l.1), miracle (fols. 40va l.11-42va l.8), absolution prayer (fols. 42va l.9-vb l.8; 44ra l.12-rb l.13; 45vb l.1-46ra l.2) and ʾarke-hymn (fols. 46ra l.3-47vb l.13). I-5) Reading for Thursday, Terce (śälästu säʿat) (fols. 47vb l.14-63va l.8); containing homily (fols. 47vb l.14-56ra l.7; 56rb l.10-61rb), absolution prayer (fols. 56ra l.7-rb l.10; 61va-vb l.4) and ʾarke-hymn (fols. 61vb l.4-63va l.8). I-6) Reading for Friday, Sext (qätr) (fols. 63va l.9-77ra); containing homily (fols. 63va l.9-65va l.12; 69vb l.15-73rb l.15; 74ra l.11-vb l.6), absolution prayer (fols. 69va l.12-vb l.15; 73vb l.9-74ra l.11; 75ra l.10-rb l.13), 3 miracles (fols. 65va l.13-69va l.12; 73rb l.16-vb l.9; 74vb l.6-75ra l.10) and ʾarke-hymn (fols. 75rb l.14-77ra) I-7) Reading for Saturday, None (täsaʿtu säʿat) (fols. 77vb-90va); containing homily (fols. 77vb-81ra l.13; 81va l.2-85va l.14; 87rb l.15-88va l.7), miracle (fols. 85va l.15-87ra l.15), absolution prayer (fols. 81ra l.14-va l.1; 87ra l.15-rb l.15; 88va l.8-vb l.8) and ʾarke-hymn (fols. 88vb l.8-90va). I-8) Reading for Sunday, Vespers (śärk) (fols. 90vb-99vb l.6); containing homily (fols. 90vb-94va l.5; 94vb l.7-96va l.15; 97ra l.2-98ra l.3), absolution prayer (fols. 94va l.6-vb l.7; 96va l.15-97ra l.1; 98ra l.3-rb l.5) and ʾarke-hymn (fols. 98rb l.5-99vb l.6).
Additiones 1-2.

msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; baptismal name of the donor; incipit of the daily readings; incipit of the sections of the daily readings; names of the days indicating daily readings; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Two groups of lines on the incipit page.

Fols. 99vb-100r: Donation note.Fol. 99vb-100r: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘወይዘሮ፡ ካህሳ፡ ስመ፡ አቡሃ፡ በረከተ፡ አብ፡ ስመ፡ እማ፡ ወለተ፡ መድኅን፡ ወእሁሃ፡ መንግሥተ፡ አብ፡ ዘወሀበቶ፡ ታቦተ፡ ሚካኤል፡ [fol.10ra] ቀርን፡ ሰበር፡ ከመ፡ ይኩን፡ መርሃ፡ ለመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ዘሰረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ ውጉዝ፡ ይኩን፡ በአፈ፡ ጴጥሮስ። መምሬ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወዘአጽሐፎ፡ በእደ፡ አቡነ፡ ገበረ፡ እግዚአብሔር። Fols. 99vb-100r: This book is of wäyzäro Kahsa and the name of her father (is) Bäräkätä ʾAb, the name of her mother Walatta Madḫǝn and her brother Mängǝśtä ʾAb, which she donated to the tabot of Mikāʾel [fol. 10ra] of Qärn Säbär, so that it might be her guide to the Kingdom of Heavens; may be condemned by the mouth of Peter who stole it or erased it. MämreTakla Hāymānot caused the book to be written by the hand of ʾabunä Gabra ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer. The note mentions the donor wäyzäro Kahsa and members of her family. Also, it includes the name of the scribe ʾabunä Gabra ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer and mämre Takla Hāymānot, who commissioned the writing. Written in the same hand as the main text.
- Pen trial: fol. 1r. - Writing exercises and doodles: fols. 1, 2, 9v, 99v, 100, 101.
